main.help_txt:
• any USB: All connected USB devices, both cameras and storage, are backed up.
  • Target rsync server: Cameras cannot be backed up directly to an rsync server. Local caching is required here.

Please read the Wiki.< /p>

camera.folder_mask_header: Directories to be backed up on smartphones and cameras
camera.folder_mask_label:
Here you can specify which directories are to be backed up by which cameras or smartphones.
Entries here have the form:
" CAMERA: PATH "
The name of a connected camera can be found on the " System " page under " Camera / Smartphone " ;.
If an instruction is to apply to all cameras, " * " (without further additions) can be used as a joker for all devices.
The path does not have to be specified in full. It is enough to use a unique part of it.
Examples:
"*:DCIM " (all cameras: all folders that contain " DCIM ")
"*:DCIM; MyCamera: IMAGES " (also from the " MyCamera " camera: all folders containing " IMAGES ")
"" (Field remains empty: Back up all folders of all cameras.)

Instead of searching for a pattern, absolute paths can also be specified. These must always be marked with "! / " start: "MyCamera:!/store_00020002/DCIM"
As soon as an absolute folder applies to a camera, there is no longer a search for a pattern for it. This saves time. More information at wiki
camera.model_folders_header: Folders to sync by camera model
camera.specific_device_folders_header: Folders to sync from specific camera
camera.device_folder_pattern: For use as pattern in Settings

backup.move_files_label: Move files instead of copying them?

cloud.target_basedir_label: The backup on the cloud server is carried out under this directory.
cloud.sync_method_label:
With a stable internet connection, the transfer with rclone seems to be significantly faster.
rsync, however, can have advantages in the event of transfer interruptions, especially with large files.
cloud.files_stay_in_place_label: Do the files remain in the storage location immediately after uploading or are they sorted away? (This only applies to rclone!)

backup.default2_settings_header: Settings for the secondary standard backup

rename.label:
An attempt is made to read the creation date from all media files on local storage devices. If this is possible, the file is renamed according to the following pattern:
For example, "Image0123.jpg" becomes "2024-10-18_23-47-26_-_Image.jpg".
rename.warning: Attention! The files should then be deleted from the source. Otherwise they will be transferred again during the next backup, renamed and replacing the version from the previous backup.

checksum.label: Consider file checksums when comparing source and destination. (Does not apply to camera transfers.)
checksum.warning: Be careful, this can significantly slow down transfers and significantly increase CPU usage. When syncing with cloud storage, this generates additional network traffic. Especially if there are already many identical files in the source and destination, synchronization can take a very long time without any transfers occurring.

imageviewer.convert_heic_label: Create jpeg images from heic (heif) format images
imageviewer.write_rating_exif_label: Ratings are immediately entered into the original files and can be used in further processing. Alternatively, these can also be transferred later from the database to the files (backup page).
imageviewer.write_rating_exif_header: Write changed ratings to original files immediately

comitup.text:
Saved WiFi access data will be deleted. An existing WiFi connection is interrupted and comitup goes into hotspot mode.
Then connect to the "little-backup-box-nnnn" WiFi hotspot. Now you can reach commitup at http://10.41.0.1. You can access the Little Backup Box WebUI here: https://10.41.0.1.

config.password_global_lbb_label: The password to protect your Little-Backup-Box. Used for the web-interface, filebrowser, ssh and samba-Windows-shares. Username in all cases is lbb. For linux-user "pi" the password is set too.
config.password_global_wifi_label: If the password has a length of 8 to 63 characters, it will also be used as a WiFi password in hotspot mode.
config.alert_password_wifi_size_error: The password cannot be used for the WiFi hotspot. For this, the length would have to be 8 to 63 characters.

vpn.type_desc: Which VPN should be activated before transferring data to a network service? Caution: The Little Backup Box interface may not be accessible while the backup is running. You may be able to reach the box under the VPN IP if your end device is also registered in the same VPN.

update.text:
Update Little Backup Box

Caution:

  • The update can render the system unusable.
  • The update can cause a considerable download volume and thus possibly costs.
  • The update can take several minutes or longer, depending on the Internet speed.

Only perform the update if you ...
  • could also perform a new installation if necessary
  • have a stable internet connection
  • have a stable power supply

screen.description: Settings that affect a screen with a graphical user interface (desktop).

config.alert_password_characters_not_allowed: The password must not contain quotation marks (‚), double quotation marks ("), spaces or backslashes (\).

exit.desc: Close Little Backup Box and free up the computer for other tasks until it restarts.
exit.idletime: This also pauses any configured shutdown after an idle time.
exit.stop_backup: Stop a backup that may be running.

tools.help_text:
Repair

Do not use unless you know what you are doing. It could damage your storage!

Procedure:

  1. Check your power supply. Power interruption may damage storage beyond repair.
  2. Make sure that no backup job is running.
  3. Do not click any buttons until all check and repair operations are completed. Do not start any processes!
  4. Run filesystem check first.
  5. If you see any errors in the log, run filesystem repair.

Format

Do not use this function if you do not know what you are doing. This will erase your storage and any lost data cannot be recovered.

Options:

  • FAT32 (Windows®): Widespread, file size is limited to 4GB.
  • exFAT (Windows®): Less common, no file size limit.
  • NTFS (Windows®): Limited compatibility with many devices, no file size limitation.
    • NTFS (compression enabled): Saves disk space, but can significantly reduce performance.
    • NTFS (no compression)
  • Ext4 (Linux): Current Linux file system
  • Ext3 (Linux): Predecessor of Ext4, only recommended if the memory also needs to be compatible with older devices that do not yet support Ext4.

Check USB device for authenticity

Do not use this function if you do not know what you are doing. This may erase your storage, and lost data cannot be recovered.

Options:

  • ERASE data (faster): f3probe runs without attempting to keep the data.
  • try to preserve data (slow): f3probe is running, attempting to preserve the data.
